text:
="preserve">Tor Torgersen (20 March 1928 – 23 October 2020) was a Norwegian long-distance runner. He was known for being part in the longest track distances, 5000 and 10,000 metres, as well as cross-country running and from around 1960 the marathon. He also competed at that year's Olympic Games.
Torgersen was born in Drammen, Norway. He died on 23 October 2020 at the age of 92.
